TITLE: How Economic Grievances Were Exploited in Britain’s Violent Unrest
SUMMARY: Nationalist hatred has been linked to forces like stagnant wages and declining services, even though research shows immigration helps many economies.

TITLE: Stellantis to Lay Off Up to 2,450 at Ram Truck Plant in Warren, Michigan
SUMMARY: The move is the latest sign of trouble for the trans-Atlantic automaker, which has had sluggish North American sales and has said it needs to cut costs.

TITLE: U.S. Vies With Allies and Industry to Tighten China Tech Controls
SUMMARY: The Biden administration must navigate the interests of U.S. companies and allied governments as it tries to close off China’s access to advanced chips

TITLE: Trump Suggests That President Should Have a ‘Say’ in Interest Rates
SUMMARY: Donald J. Trump said presidents should have input on interest rates, a comment likely to stoke fears that he could try to limit the Federal Reserve’s political independence.

TITLE: Mortgage Rates Drop Sharply, With 30-Year at 6.47%
SUMMARY: The key mortgage rate had its biggest one-week decline of the year, falling to the lowest level in 15 months.

TITLE: From Tips to TikTok, Trump Swaps Policies With Aim to Please Voters
SUMMARY: The former president’s economic agenda has made some notable reversals from the policies he pushed while in the White House.

TITLE: Fed Rate Cuts Are Expected Soon, as Inflation Cools. But Will They Be Early Enough to Avoid a Recession?
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve was about to cut interest rates, turning the corner after a long fight with inflation. But now, its soft landing is in question.

TITLE: Trump Dangles New Tax Cut Proposals With Real Political Appeal
SUMMARY: The most recent and costliest of Mr. Trump’s ideas would end income taxes on Social Security benefits.

TITLE: Disney Parks Struggle, Exposing New Trouble Spot
SUMMARY: Companywide profit increased, the result of hit movies and streaming growth. But Disney said softening theme park demand “could impact the next few quarters.”

TITLE: To Avoid an Economic Recession, Consumer Spending Is Key
SUMMARY: Consumer spending has powered the economic recovery from the pandemic shock. Now wallets are thinner, and some businesses are feeling the difference.

TITLE: Apple Store Workers Get First U.S. Contract
SUMMARY: The agreement at a Maryland store, the first to unionize, raises wages roughly 10 percent over three years and guarantees benefits and severance pay.

TITLE: World’s Five Leading Chipmakers Have Now Promised U.S. Investment
SUMMARY: The announcement of CHIPS Act funding for a plant in Indiana means the United States will have attracted investment from the world’s top chipmakers.

TITLE: Stock Markets Signal Recession Fears. Here’s the Economic Outlook.
SUMMARY: The economy has repeatedly defied predictions of a downturn since the pandemic recovery began. Now signs of strength contend with shakier readings.

TITLE: JD Vance Pioneered ‘New Right’ Economics. Trump May Not Embrace It.
SUMMARY: The vice-presidential nominee favors economic policies that help advance a socially conservative vision of American society — and that sometimes clash with Trump’s own plans.

TITLE: S&P and Nasdaq Drop as Jobs Report Shakes Market
SUMMARY: The report on hiring in July added to worries about the economy. Stocks fell sharply, and Treasury yields declined in expectation of a Federal Reserve rate cut.

TITLE: Is the Fed Behind the Curve? As Unemployment Rises, Worries Mount.
SUMMARY: Central bankers are preparing to cut interest rates, and are monitoring job data as they consider when and how much to lower them.

TITLE: July Jobs Report: What to Know
SUMMARY: U.S. employers added 114,000 jobs in July, far short of forecasts, and unemployment rose to 4.3 percent, the highest level since 2021.

TITLE: Opportunity Zones, Lauded by Trump, Don’t Always Help Poor
SUMMARY: A tax incentive, with bipartisan roots, aims to foster development in poor areas. It has fueled building, but it hasn’t always aided local residents.

TITLE: Productivity Surges 2.3%, Beating Forecasts
SUMMARY: Output was up sharply in the second quarter, with the rise in goods produced far exceeding the increase in hours worked.

TITLE: Trump Promises Lower Interest Rates, but the President Doesn’t Control Those
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve sets interest rates, and it operates independently of the White House. But rates could come down as inflation cools.
